content.body: Beth and John were hiking in the Florida Everglades.John is a diabetic.While hiking he fell and cut his big toe. Later that week he came to the emergency room complaining of pain in the foot and swelling. He has redness and some blackened tissue around the cut. His blood pressure is 90/50. What do you suspect he has? What treatment is necessary to clear this infection? What precautions are needed in a case like this?

htmlAnswers.answerPreview: Foot problems are common in people with diabetes.Diabetes may cause nerve damage, also called diabetic neuropathy,can make diabatic person lose feeling in his feet. When a diabatic person loses feeling in his feet which can lead to cuts a
